sentence1: It also named Robert Willumstad chief operating officer , also to take effect by Jan. 1 , 2004 .
sentence2: Robert B. Willumstad , 57 , Citigroup 's president , was named chief operating officer .

sentence1: Monday ratcheted up its database software line with the introduction of a new suite that automates the process of defining , describing and indexing information contained in the database .
sentence2: DB2 Cube Views automates the process of creating metadata by defining , describing , and indexing information in a database .

sentence1: The dollar 's slide against the yen was curbed by wariness that Japanese authorities could intervene to stem the yen 's rise .
sentence2: Despite hefty losses against the euro , the dollar 's slide versus the yen was curbed by wariness that Japanese authorities could intervene to stem the yen 's rise .

sentence1: The US responded coolly to the EU deadline , warning that trade sanctions would backfire by hurting European consumers .
sentence2: The US administration responded coolly to the EU deadline , warning that trade sanctions would backfire by hurting European consumers but pledging " to comply with our international obligations " .

sentence1: J.D. Edwards shareholders will receive 0.86 of a share of PeopleSoft for each share of J.D. Edwards .
sentence2: Shareholders will get 0.86 PeopleSoft share , or $ 13.11 , for each J.D. Edwards share , based on recent trading prices .

sentence1: The seal will ultimately be used to identify DHS badges , vehicles , signs , sea vessels and aircraft .
sentence2: The seal will ultimately be used on department materials , signage , credentials , badges , vehicles , sea vessels and aircraft .

sentence1: " His advice to the House Republicans is to pass it , to send it to him , so he can sign it . "
sentence2: The president 's " advice to the House Republicans is to pass it , to send it to him , so he can sign it , " said White House spokesman Ari Fleischer .

sentence1: In Falluja on Thursday , two grenades were thrown at soldiers from the Third Armored Cavalry Regiment , wounding seven .
sentence2: In Al-Fallujah , two grenades were thrown Thursday at soldiers from the 3rd Armored Cavalry Regiment , wounding seven , none seriously .
